patterns_discovered.description: Extensive use of styled() for custom styled components (StyledDrawer, Header, TabsContainer, etc.) with theme integration
Component accepts optional callbacks and data through props with sensible defaults
Using tabs to filter notifications by category with 'all' as default view
Renders different UI based on notification list length and selected category
Header and tabs use sticky positioning with z-index management for scroll behavior

gotchas_discovered.description: TabsContainer positioned at top: 72 to sit below Header which uses top: 0. Careful coordination needed when modifying header height.
gotchas_discovered.impact: Visual stacking issues if header height changes without updating TabsContainer top value

gotchas_discovered.description: Uses string comparison for category filtering (selectedCategory === 'all') which requires exact string matching with notification.category values
gotchas_discovered.impact: Type safety could be improved with enum usage

gotchas_discovered.description: Component relies on NotificationItem component and custom Tabs component that must exist and match expected props
gotchas_discovered.impact: Runtime errors if dependencies are missing or have incompatible interfaces

gotchas_discovered.description: Callbacks like onMarkAsRead and onMarkAllAsRead are optional but called conditionally. Missing implementations will silently fail to mark notifications as read.
gotchas_discovered.impact: Potential UX confusion if callbacks not properly wired by parent component

approach_outcome.implementation_strategy: Created a fully-featured React component using Material-UI that provides a right-aligned drawer panel for displaying notifications with filtering, pagination, and read status management.
key_accomplishments: Implemented Material-UI Drawer with custom styling
Added tab-based filtering system for notification categories
Created sticky header with unread count badge
Applied consistent theming with Material-UI theme system
approach_outcome.session_progression: Session 8 completed subtask 3-2, moving project from 1 to 7 completed subtasks across 13 total, advancing from Backend phase to Frontend UI Components phase

recommendations.recommendation: Replace string-based category filtering with TypeScript enum for NotificationCategory to ensure type safety and reduce potential matching errors
Verify that NotificationItem and custom Tabs components have compatible prop interfaces and add prop validation or PropTypes
Document or extract the magic number '72' for TabsContainer top value as a constant to prevent maintenance issues if header height changes
Add ARIA labels, keyboard navigation support, and ensure close button and action buttons are properly announced to screen readers
Consider implementing virtualization for large notification lists to improve rendering performance with many notifications
Add error state handling for failed mark-as-read operations and loading error states
Create unit tests covering tab filtering logic, empty state conditions, and callback invocations
